Package org.opensextant.xtext.collectors.web

Class DefaultWebCrawl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opensextant.xtext.collectors.web.WebClient
      • org.opensextant.xtext.collectors.web.DefaultWebCrawl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Collector, CrawlFilter, ExclusionFilter

    public class DefaultWebCrawl
extends WebClient
implements ExclusionFilter, Collector, CrawlFilter
    A demonstration of how to use the WebClient to crawl a site and convert it as you go. An optional collection listener is settable to let you do something with each item collected/converted.
    Author:
    ubaldino

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected CollectionListener listener
      A collection listener to consult as far as how to record the found & converted content as well as to determine what is worth saving.

                       org.opensextant.ConfigException

    • Method Detail

      • setListener

        public void setListener​(CollectionListener l)
        Important that you set a listener if you want to see what was captured. As well as optimize future harvests. Listener tells the collector if the item in question was harvested or not.
        Parameters:
        l - listener to use

      • filterOutFile

        public boolean filterOutFile​(String path)
        For web crawl, this default crawler considers flash, video media, etc. to be out of scope. Other HREF links, like mailto:xyz@me.com are also items to avoid. Method is left open so you may override.
        Specified by:
        filterOutFile in interface ExclusionFilter
        Parameters:
        path - a url
        Returns:
        if file should be ignored

      • collect

        public void collect​()
             throws IOException
        Run the collection. Make sure you have set your converter and collection listener If you have a converter that also has a conversion listener, whoa!! good luck. This web crawl example is meant to provide the mechanics of the conversion listener as implemented by the collection listener. The details on how actions at collection time differ from conversion time are TBD.
        Specified by:
        collect in interface Collector
        Throws:
        IOException - on collection err

      • filterOut

        public boolean filterOut​(HyperLink link)
        Override this if you have differnt ideas about what URL patterns are of interest. DEFAULT FILTER OUT: video files, page anchors, mailto links
        Parameters:
        link - a URL
        Returns:
        true if link should be ignored.

      • collectItems

        public void collectItems​(String _link,
                         URL startingSite)
                  throws IOException,
                         NoSuchAlgorithmException
        recursive folder crawl through a site. This is where docs are converted and recorded. As hashing algorithms are used in defining concise output paths, NoSuchAlgorithmException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        _link - a URL
        startingSite - the top level site
        Throws:
        IOException - on err
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - error that never happens

      • collect

        public void collect​(File f)
             throws IOException
        Parameters:
        f - file object
        Throws:
        IOException - on err

      • userFilteredOut

        protected boolean userFilteredOut​(String path)
        User filters are likely to be more general ALLOW, but specific DENIES within what is allowed.
        Parameters:
        path - filepath
        Returns:
        if user options filter out the given path

        IOException - on err

        If crawl requested URL A, then only URLS starting with string(A) will be accepted.

      • isAllowCurrentSiteOnly

        public boolean isAllowCurrentSiteOnly​()
        Description copied from interface: CrawlFilter
        Allow all links to be archived when link from requested page resides on current web site; Even when requested crawl is deeper than top level site home page. For example, requested http://a.com/b/c, any link on a.com will be grabbed.
        Specified by:
        isAllowCurrentSiteOnly in interface CrawlFilter
        Returns:
        the allowCurrentSiteOnly
        See Also:
        CrawlFilter.isAllowCurrentSiteOnly()
